newsitem.title: UK: Forward shares retreat after profit warning.
newsitem.headline: Forward shares retreat after profit warning.

text.p: Shares in Forward Technology Industries Plc lost nearly a third of their value on Thursday after the company said it expects to realise a small pretax loss for the year ending December 31, 1996.
By 0952 GMT, shares in the company had retreated 11-1/2p to Trade at a year low of 27-1/2p. The stock traded as high as 101p earlier this year.
The electronics group made pretax profits of 3.55 million stg for the year ending December 31, 1995.

Forward blamed the pretax loss forecast on additional costs due to difficulty in completing contracts at its U.S. subsidiary. It said that all associated costs will be provided for in the current financial year.
It also said that sales at its Sound and Vision division have been at lower levels during October and November than expected.
